p.salute: Good evening ladies and gentlemen, fellow students and politicians

p.s: Thank you for the invitation to speak at this international student conference The future of globalization.
It means a lot to me to be able to stand here and talk about a topic the effects each and everyone of us.
Globalization is a topic where everyone can say something about it.
We are all the result of globalization.
Take a look at the situation now.
It is an international conference where we come together from many diffirentdifferent parts of the world and discuss the future of globalization.
I, personally want to talk about the benefits of globalization.
I came across a very interesstinginteresting and somewhat disturbing article online by Peter Daszak.
The article deals with our current pandemic.

While reading I realized that many people think negativlynegatively about globalization, becausbecause just like right now, we are in the middle of a global pandemic, which is partly the result of globalization.
I personally don't think that the pandemic is only caused by globalization as written in the online article I read.
That is why, driven by the article, I am standing here to talk about the positivpositive aspects of globalization.
Now, first off I can agree that pandemics like our current Covid-19 are able to spread rapitlyrapidly because of globalization.
Airplane, cars, trains, boats.
Through all of these inventions people traveled more than ever, so it is not a surprise that the virus originated in China, reached almost every corner of earth, and what felt like seconds.
But pandemics have always existed.
Viruses always existed.
Like the sars virus from 2003.
Pandemics are always going to happen no matter white.
So why should we not travel around the world and enjoy the different cultures and multicultural societies?
I don't think the pandemics should stop us from globalizing.
Through for example social media and generally digitization we can learn about different cultures, which is an enrichment.
People are more openminded and curious about new cultures.
Polycultures instead of monocultures develop.
There is more acceptance and tolerance than ever before.
If you think about yourself, what music do you listen to?
What food do you eat?
What do you wear?
Or what languages do you speak?
Let us take me as an example.
My parents are from Turkey but we live in Germany.
I grew up with two very diffirentdifferent cultures and learn from both of them.
German people also eatseat lots of different foods like Italian, Spanish or Vietnamese.
There are plenty of diffirentdifferent cuisines that you can try out in Germany.
It even helps people from these countries to integrate into society better because, what they are used to in their home country can be found here as well.
If the world wasn't globalized I would not be able to enjoy my hobbies like traditional Korean martial arts.
They teach Taekwondotae kwon do in Germany, which came all the way from South Korea.
Amazing isn't it?
My master is also Korean and I was lucky to learn a lot from him about Korean culture as well and it taught me many life lessons.
I definetlydefinitely think that the mixing of cultures and the opportunity to explore new ones is amazing.
But of course thethere are different reactions to globalization when it comes to cultures globalizing.
A lot of people might see it as a threat to their culture.
They feel like their own culture is beeingbeing alienated or taken away from them.
A lot of people have difficulties identifying with a group of people and don't know where they belong.
We have seen this in a very recent example.
The Brexit.
Allegedly the majority of britishBritish people felt like their culture is in dangeourdanger.
Rising nationalism and xenophobia can be spotted all over the world.
So, is that the future of globalization?
More racism, xenophobia and nationalism?
Are more and more nations closing their borders like Britain, not only because of fear of loosinglosing the culture, but also because of the pandemic?
That is a tricky question, because at the end there is not much we can do, when countries want to close their borders.
There is a noticablenoticeable change in nationalism and xenophobia in this world and the pandemic gives countries just another reason to close the borders.
In contrast to the article I read, iI still think that globalization is something great and we should not bring it down and see it negativelynegativly just because of our current pandemic.
I I have hope and I do not think that racism, xenophobia or nationalism will overshadow the good sides about globalization.
We all as humans should stay open minded and not let the pandemic ruin the benefits of globalization.
So dear fellow students and politianspoliticians around, please take into account what just has been said and try to make the world more tolleranttolerant and accepting through your power.
It was an honor to give this speachspeech.
Thanks a lot for listening.
